title: Judge grants final approval to House settlement
content: Schools are now free to begin paying their athletes directly, marking the dawn of a new era in college sports brought about by a multibillion-dollar legal settlement that was formally approved Friday.

title: Sources: Knicks interested in speaking with Kidd
content: The New York Knicks are conducting active due diligence on Dallas Mavericks coach Jason Kidd among other head coaching candidates in their search to replace Tom Thibodeau, sources told ESPN.

title: Sinner beats Djokovic, advances to French final
content: Top seed Jannik Sinner advanced to the French Open final by defeating No. 6 seed Novak Djokovic 6-4, 7-5, 7-6 (3) in Friday's semifinal.

title: D-backs ace Burnes to have Tommy John surgery
content: Diamondbacks righty Corbin Burnes will undergo Tommy John surgery, manager Torey Lovullo announced Friday. Burnes left his last start in the fifth inning with elbow discomfort.

title: Sandler to cast Ravens' Henry if he rushes for 2K
content: Actor/comedian Adam Sandler has promised to cast Ravens running back Derrick Henry in a future movie if he can reach 2,000 yards rushing next season.

title: Concerned McIlroy misses cut by 12 at Canadian
content: Rory McIlroy tumbled out of the RBC Canadian Open on Friday with his second-highest score to par in any PGA Tour round of his career, with Cameron Champ taking a two-stroke lead into the weekend in the final event before the U.S. Open.

title: Nunes to unretire, calls for Peña-Harrison winner
content: Former two-weight champion Amanda Nunes said she is "going to be ready" to come out of retirement to face the winner of the Julianna Pena-Kayla Harrison title bout at UFC 316.

title: Braves call up vet Kimbrel after bullpen implodes
content: Former Braves closer Craig Kimbrel is coming back to where it all began as he will rejoin the club after being called up from Triple-A to help a faltering Atlanta bullpen.

title: 👀 Prospect watch: 2026 NFL draft QB class
content: Will Cade Klubnik, LaNorris Sellers or Drew Allar be QB1 in next year's draft? And who are the other names to know in the class?

title: The incredible never-before-told story of the home run ball that turned Derek Jeter into 'Mr. November'
content: Fistfuls of flying dollars, an alert vendor and a Jeter signature. Here's the tale of one of MLB's most famous artifacts.

title: Aaron Rodgers to the Steelers -- finally: Grading the move, and whether he's actually an upgrade
content: The Steelers finally landed Rodgers after months of anticipation. But can the move actually improve the offense? Let's grade the signing.

title: Who will win the French Open women's title?
content: It's between No. 1 Sabalenka and No. 2 Gauff for the French Open title. Our experts make predictions.

title: USMNT depth chart: Top 15 at each position entering Gold Cup
content: Where does the USMNT roster stand entering the Gold Cup? Here are the top 15 players at each position.

title: Pro softball is on deck! What to know about the inaugural AUSL season
content: The league will feature four teams and a touring model that will serve as a "tryout" for prospective home cities next season.

title: Why film study is so important to young NFL QBs like the Bears' Caleb Williams
content: Not only did the Bears hire an offensive-minded head coach in Ben Johnson, but they signed Case Keenum to mentor Williams.

title: 'The Game 1 collapse was insane': What led the Knicks to fire Tom Thibodeau
content: Despite back-to-back 50-win seasons, whispers about Tom Thibodeau's future in New York had percolated for months.

title: 2025 Mountain West Conference preview: Can Boise State do it again?
content: The Broncos, the Group of 5 standard-bearer, reached the CFP. They might be MWC favorites, but others in the league made big moves.

title: PLL Week 2 preview: Everything you need to know for Chaos homecoming
content: The PLL heads to Charlotte for four games. Check here for the full schedule, key stats, injury notes and more.

title: 'I do record everything': The told and untold stories of Merab Dvalishvili
content: Merab Dvalishvili, the UFC champion Dana White once called "next-level stupid," is slowly taking over the internet.

title: Ronaldo throwback? Real Madrid launch new home kit for CWC
content: Real Madrid's new home kit is similar to 2009-10, pays homage to the Bernabeu stadium and will be worn at this summer's Club World Cup.

title: Poch: New-look USMNT must 'fight for place' at WC
content: USMNT coach Mauricio Pochettino said it's important to focus on the opportunity for his young squad, rather than the absences of several senior players.

title: Spurs fire Postecoglou despite Europa League win
content: Tottenham Hotspur sacked head coach Ange Postecoglou on Friday after deciding a change was necessary for the club "to compete on multiple fronts."

title: Portugal's Neves: NL final not Ronaldo vs. Yamal
content: Portugal midfielder João Neves says Sunday's UEFA Nations League final is not just Lamine Yamal against Cristiano Ronaldo.

title: LaLiga: Barça's Raphinha POY, Yamal Best U23
content: Barcelona winger Raphinha was named LaLiga Player of the Season on Friday, after the Brazilian played a major role in his side winning the domestic treble, with club teammate Lamine Yamal named Best Under-23 player.

title: Matic, Hassan banned for hiding anti-LGBTQ+ sign
content: Lyon's Nemanja Matic and Le Havre's Ahmed Hassan have been handed two-game bans after they concealed Ligue 1's anti-homophobia sign on their shirts.

title: Source: USWNT's Fishel in talks with NWSL clubs
content: United States women's national team forward Mia Fishel is in discussions with multiple NWSL teams about a summer transfer away from Chelsea, a source with knowledge of the situation told ESPN.

title: Man United reveal financial boost despite PL woes
content: Manchester United raised their annual core profit forecast on Friday as the club's strong performance in the Europa League drove ticket sales and broadcast revenue.

title: ⚽ Top 100 men's soccer players in the world
content: It's that time again: with the UEFA Champions League final behind us and the 2024-25 season officially over, it's time to rank the top 100 players in the world of men's soccer right now. Welcome to the FC 100.

title: How members of the Pasadena Run Club are finding salvation in a post-wildfire world
content: Though still reeling from the Eaton fire, a group of L.A. area runners are determined to build a worthwhile future.

title: Ranking every WNBA team's roster core, 1-13: Which team has the best young players?
content: Let's stack every WNBA team's core by the youth of its roster, leading off with the Fever and Caitlin Clark.

title: Power Rankings: Dream ride four-game winning streak to move up in Week 3 edition
content: Las Vegas, Washington and Chicago join Atlanta as risers as the league begins Commissioner's Cup play.

title: Plucked from Dunkin', QB J'Mar Smith leads the Stallions into the playoffs
content: Smith, a former Stallions signal-caller, had given up on football before a string of injuries brought about his return.

title: Ranking the top 64 NHL draft prospects, including projected ceilings and floors
content: There is no hockey left to be played this season for the top players available June 27-28. Here's how they stack up.

title: Projects worth ₹11 crore inaugurated in 18 villages of Nellore Rural
content: The projects were undertaken on a priority basis by the local legislator Kotamreddy Sridhar Reddy and completed in a record time

title: Law and order has collapsed in State, alleges Jagan Mohan Reddy
content: Mr. Jagan said he was shocked and pained by the “complete collapse of law and order” under Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu’s governance

title: Germany’s Merz says he found Trump open to dialogue and committed to NATO
content: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz says he found President Donald Trump open to discussion and is convinced that Washington remains committed to the NATO alliance

title: West Bengal LoP Suvendu Adhikari accuses State of ‘suppressing’ fresh Covid data
content: Official Covid bulletins have not been released on the State Health Department website since January 28, 2023

title: Meghalaya: Missing Indore woman’s brother suspects she was abducted
content: The family of Raja Raghuvanshi, whose body was recovered from a gorge, has petitioned Prime Minister Narendra Modi for a CBI probe

title: Assamese web series spotlights NRC ‘scam’
content: The lead character is based on the man whose petition in the Supreme Court in 2009 led to the exercise of updating the citizens’ list in Assam

title: A sunken ship and a sea of worries
content: On May 25, a container ship sank off the coast of Kerala. While all the 24 crew members were rescued, some of the ship’s containers with hazardous cargo have either gone down with the vessel or have washed ashore. While the world worries about environmental pollution from this particular incident, John L. Paul finds that the fisher folk are more concerned about indiscriminate mining and the dumping of untreated pollutants

title: Rediscovery of the Losgna genus in India: a new species of parasitic wasp discovered in Chandigarh, named - ‘Losgna Occidentalis’
content: The rediscovery of the Losgna genus in India, after close to six decades, and describes “a new species collected from an urban dry scrub forest in Chandigarh”

title: Pawan Kalyan donates ₹50 lakh to kin of Pahalgam victim
content: The Minister also announced that the party would stand in support of the bereaved family even for its future requirements

title: Haryana IMA seeks clarity on State govt.’s cashless treatment scheme for accident victims
content: Under the scheme, the road accident victims would be administered cashless emergency care of up to ₹1.5 lakh with a cap of maximum of seven days

title: Kidney transplant in Tamil Nadu sets record for shortest wait time
content: At a press briefing, experts and the kidney transplant recipient highlighted the need for clinical excellence, affordable care, and equitable access in transplant services

title: Stalin says Ministry of Home Affairs’ remarks on delimitation are ‘vague’
content: The Chief Minister asserts that if delimitation is carried out based on the Census 2027, democratic power of peninsular India will be reduced to irrelevance. He also calls for a clear Parliamentary commitment

title: Hyderabad in fragments: a city’s story told in micro-histories
content: In his new book, author Daneesh Majid pieces together a mosaic of lives altered by Operation Polo, migration and memory, offering a people’s history of a city often defined by dynasties and politics

title: How ocean science is feeding coastal India
content: The ocean is vast, but fishermen no longer have to guess, thanks to INCOIS’ Potential Fishing Zone advisories generated from ocean data and high-resolution satellite imagery. Catches are up, fuel use is down and incomes are rising, proving that precision fishing is not just possible, but profitable too

title: Influencer Sharmistha Panoli walks out of Alipore Jail in hate speech case
content: The 22-year-old was granted bail by the Calcutta High Court on Thursday and released on Friday afternoon

title: Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme labour budget cut to 12 crore person-days in Tamil Nadu
content: During 2024-25 too, the State was allotted only 20 crore person-days. Later, the Centre approved around 10 crore more person-days

title: State public health lab develops molecular tests to identify deadly amoeba
content: This is the first  time that the lab has managed to identify and give confirmatory diagnosis of the causative organism of amoebic encephalitis in a human sample using molecular  diagnostic tests developed in its own lab. The lab has developed tests to identify five species of amoeba which are commonly found to cause serious disease in humans

title: Govt. inks pact with NVIDIA on establishment of AI University in Andhra Pradesh
content: As part of the agreement, 10,000 engineering students across the State will be upskilled in the next two years

title: Buzz: What will Aaron Rodgers' arrival mean for Steelers' skill players?
content: Aaron Rodgers is headed to the Steelers, but expectations of a return to fantasy greatness should be tempered.

title: Vick, Iverson ... Keyshawn? Norfolk roots connect Davis to sports legends
content: Michael Vick, Allen Iverson, Pernell Whitaker... and Keyshawn Davis? Meet the newest face in sports to come out of Norfolk, Virginia.

title: Betting the 2025 Belmont Stakes: What you need to know to make a smart race wager
content: From the basics to insider intel, here are betting tips and everything else you need to know for Saturday's Belmont Stakes.

title: Golf odds: Scottie Scheffler the betting favorite in each of the next four majors
content: Odds for next four golf majors: 2025 U.S. Open, Open Championship, 2026 Masters and PGA Championship.

title: What we're hearing in the transfer window: Chelsea eye Ekitike; Man United out of Osimhen race
content: The summer transfer window is now open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done? Get the latest every Friday.

title: India’s next goal is to be among world’s top defence exporters, says PM
content: ‘The faster India moves towards this objective, the more employment opportunities will be generated nationwide’

title: Experience life by Odisha’s Chilika Lake at the Rambha Palace, a boutique hotel with European aesthetics
content: Rambha Palace, a 200-year-old historical structure at Ganjam in Odisha is now a boutique hotel. We walk through its carpeted floors and sprawling lawns, visit local fish markets and interact with bamboo artisans to experience the best of Odia culture

title: Suspension of police commissioner rankles police establishment
content: ‘There was not even a preliminary inquiry which found a prima facie lapse. How could a commissioner be suspended like this?’

title: BJD only did politics for 24 years, our Government has ushered in new era in Odisha: CM Majhi
content: After almost a year in office, Mohan Majhi, the head of Odisha’s first BJP government, says the “larger vision” is to make Odisha a “developed and prosperous” State. He says the government is making up for “lost time” and is proactive in “putting Odisha among the top five industrial States”

title: Chenab bridge designed to survive loss of one of its piers
content: The credit for conceptualising the design that allows this stability goes to G. Madhavi Lata, Professor of Civil Engineering at the Indian Institute of Science, Bengaluru; she says the challenge was to ensure that the foundations of the bridge are extremely strong

title: Welcoming PM’s rail initiative, Mehbooba, Mirwaiz demand prisoners’ release, dialogue on Kashmir
content: The Mirwaiz says, “If the Prime Minister truly seeks to reduce the ‘dil ki doori’ (distance of hearts) which he often mentions in his speeches, then humanitarian steps are the real way forward”

title: Trinamool MLA says Operation Sindoor was  ‘politicised drama’, BJP seeks probe
content: In the video Mr. Chakraborty says that tourist spots in Kashmir are heavily guarded, so how was the terror attack possible

title: Medium of instruction in higher education to prioritise Indian languages: Pradhan
content: Union Education Minister chairs consultative meeting in Indore; emphasis on technology, multilingualism and AI-based translation tools

title: CPI(M) calls for all-party meet on modalities of census
content: General Secretary M.A. Baby says government must address the apprehensions of southern States over losing political representation in view of the coming delimitation exercise

title: Kamal Haasan, DMK and AIADMK candidates file nominations for Rajya Sabha election
content: The last day of filing nominations is June 9). Any nominations received will be taken up for scrutiny the following day. The last day for withdrawal of nominations, if any, is June 12. If there is any contest, the polling is scheduled on June 19. As on Friday, nine candidates have submitted their papers

title: Delhi HC sets aside appointment of NCISMC chairperson
content: The court held that Vaidya Jayant Yeshwant Deopujari does not meet the qualification prescribed for appointment to the office

title: India stands isolated on global stage in collapse of foreign policy: Congress
content: Congress criticises Modi government’s foreign policy “failures”, highlighting India’s diplomatic isolation and lack of influence on global stage

title: ‘Whatever people wish’, Uddhav Thackeray drops hint on reunion with Raj Thackeray
content: Mr. Thackeray’s statement has fuelled the possibility of a political rapprochement after two decades, as they took different paths, with Raj Thackeray forming his party, MNS, in 2005 and Uddhav Thackeray heading the undivided Shiv Sena

title: Sponsors and perpetrators of terror must be brought to justice, say Central Asian countries
content: They came together at the India-Central Asia Dialogue and reaffirmed their firm commitment to fight terrorism

title: India’s defence capabilities advanced remarkably, says former DRDO chairman G. Satheesh Reddy
content: Young innovators should drive AI-based technologies, as the country continues to emerge as a global leader in defence, technology, and research,  Honorary Advisor (Aerospace & Defence) in Andhra Pradesh government, said delivering the convocation address of SR University

title: Bhaskar, Maoist carrying ₹45 lakh bounty, killed in Bijapur operation: police
content: Bhaskar was a member of the Telangana State Committee of the banned CPI (Maoist). An AK-47 along with other explosives, weapons and ammunition were recovered from the encounter site, said police

title: Active COVID-19 cases cross 5,000; Centre steps up preparedness measures
content: Kerala reports highest number of infections; mock drills underway nationwide to assess facility readiness

title: Minister for denotifying forest land granted before notifying under Section 4 of forest Act
content: Forest Minister Eshwar Khandre assures elected representatives of Chikkamagaluru that the State government will approach the Centre and Supreme Court to resolve the issue

title: Uttam vows to intensify battle against AP’s ‘illegal’ Banakacherla project
content: Blames previous BRS regime for AP’s RLIP, PRP expansion; Harish Rao rebuts Congress stating that it was BRS Govt. that had secured stay on RLIP

title: Government extends distribution of eggs/bananas to children in pre-primary classes in government schools
content: A total of ₹755.62 crore has been earmarked this year for the distribution of eggs/bananas to students from pre-primary classes to class 10

title: Madras High Court summons Greater Chennai City Commissioner of Police
content: Justice P. Velmurugan directs A. Arun to be present in the court on June 9, 2025 to explain alleged police inaction on a SC/ST complaint

title: Railways take lead in holding series of sustainability initiatives
content: A total of 35 sapling plantation programmes were held at various stations, resulting in the planting of 1,210 saplings. Additionally, 32 sapling distribution programmes enabled the distribution of 1,131 saplings to railway employees, passengers, and public

title: Invite tenders for Polavaram–Banakacherla project by June-end, CM tells Water Resources Dept.
content: Chandrababu Naidu directs officials to take steps for land acquisition for the project which will be taken up with Central funding and EAP loan

title: 800-year-old Shiva temple of later Pandya period unearthed near Melur
content: Only the foundation of the temple remains. But the inscriptions on the culvert are significant in that they reveal how the temple had been financially independent, and that the name of the village was Attur and of the temple was Thennavanisvaram

title: Longest elevated highway taking shape
content: Though the ongoing construction has turned the corridor into a major bottleneck,  it is making progress with 65% of the work completed. Once finished, it will be the longest flyover in the country under the NHAI.

title: Roof sheet collapse: Congress files complaint with human rights panel
content: Opposition in Thrissur Corporation council seeks legal action against officials responsible. The building is owned by the Corporation

title: Former Coal Secretary acquitted in coal block case; firm, director convicted
content: Delhi court clears H.C. Gupta and others; convicts Jas Infrastructure and director for misrepresentation in Mahuagarhi coal block allocation

title: Information Commission rejects society’s contention; orders appointment of SPIO
content: After receiving an RTI query regarding gratuity disbursed to employees, SATHHES had initially denied the request, stating that it does not fall under the ambit of the Act

title: In first foreign trip after Operation Sindoor, PM likely to highlight Pak's terror export
content: Following an invitation from Canadian PM Mark Carney, PM Modi has accepted to attend the G7 summit in Alberta. This decision comes after speculation about his participation and amid efforts to mend strained relations following allegations regarding the murder of Hardeep Singh Nijjar.

title: Navy set to induct 1st of 16 desi shallow water craft on June 18
content: The Indian Navy is preparing to commission INS Arnala, the first of 16 anti-submarine warfare shallow watercraft, on June 18th in Visakhapatnam. Built by GRSE and L&T Shipbuilders, this 77-meter warship features over 80% indigenous content and advanced underwater sensors. These warships are being built at Indian shipyards at an overall cost of Rs 12,622 crore.

title: From YouTubers to spies: ISI’s new playbook
content: Punjab Police suspect Pakistan's ISI is using Indian YouTubers for espionage, arresting Jasbir Singh, who has 11 lakh subscribers, for allegedly sharing sensitive information. This follows the arrest of YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra and several others, including a cobbler and tailor, indicating a broader ISI strategy to gather intelligence and potentially influence public opinion through online personalities with wide reach

title: 'Should do all it can': US lawmaker tells Pak delegation to eliminate terror groups
content: US Congressman Brad Sherman urged a Pakistani delegation, led by Bilawal Bhutto Zardari, to eliminate Jaish-e-Mohammad and protect religious minorities. Sherman highlighted the murder of his constituent, Daniel Pearl, by the group. He also called for the release of Dr. Shakil Afridi, imprisoned for aiding in Osama bin Laden's killing.

title: Musk vs Trump: Elon Musk unfollows top Trump ally Stephen Miller; days after wife Katie Miller joined his team
content: Elon Musk has unfollowed Stephen Miller and Charlie Kirk on social media amid a feud with Donald Trump over the "One Big Beautiful Bill." Musk criticized the bill, claiming it contradicted DOGE's budget-cutting goals, leading to a public spat with Miller. Trump expressed disappointment with Musk's stance, alleging he changed his position after learning about EV mandate cuts.

title: WACE of Australia is 1st foreign government-backed board in India
content: Australia expands its educational presence in India, with Western Australia's WACE becoming the first foreign government-backed school board to gain equivalence for its Class X and XII qualifications in 25 years.

title: 75+ messages, greetings, wishes and quotes for Eid-ul-Adha 2025
content: Eid ul-Adha, a significant day for Muslims globally, commemorates Prophet Ibrahim's devotion and is celebrated with prayers, gratitude, and charitable giving. Families honor the occasion by sacrificing an animal and sharing it with loved ones and those in need.

title: Patient raped in ICU of Rajasthan hospital by nursing staffer
content: In Alwar, a shocking incident occurred at ESIC Medical College where a 32-year-old woman, recovering from a tubectomy in the surgical ICU, was allegedly raped by a nursing staff member. Following the husband's complaint and the woman's disclosure, police have registered a case, and the accused, Subhash Ghithala, has been barred from the hospital.

title: Smartphone wars: Steve Ballmer may have agreed with Android co-founder; Gates cost Microsoft $400B
content: Former Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer acknowledged that overconfidence in Windows led to the company's failure in the smartphone market. He admitted Microsoft tried forcing Windows into unsuitable areas like mobile and automotive, resulting in poor user experiences.

title: Win for Trump: US SC allows DOGE to access social security data
content: The Supreme Court sided with the Trump administration in two cases concerning the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), allowing access to Social Security data and limiting transparency. These rulings, opposed by liberal justices, arrive amid tensions between the president and former DOGE head Elon Musk. The decisions spark privacy concerns and questions about DOGE's future direction.

title: Government asks states to adhere to timelines after launch of Waqf portal
content: The government launched a Central Waqf Portal, requiring registered properties to upload details for a unique ID, aligning with the Waqf Amendment Act 2025. Minister Rijiju emphasized that only legitimate, documented properties will be included, urging states to meet the six-month deadline for uploading information. The portal aims for transparency and efficiency, though its legal validity faces challenges.

title: Ukraine used open-source software in drone attack; Developer upset, says wanted to...
content: ArduPilot, an open-source software initially created for hobbyist drones, has reportedly been used in a Ukrainian attack that destroyed a portion of Russia's strategic bomber fleet. The software's creators expressed surprise at its military application, as it was originally designed for peaceful purposes like search and rescue and autonomous vehicles.

title: Immigration rules: Canada looks to ease citizenship by descent norms; how Indian diaspora may benefit
content: Canada's immigration minister has introduced legislation to extend citizenship by descent beyond the first generation, addressing concerns raised by a previous court ruling. The proposed Bill C-3 aims to grant automatic citizenship to those previously excluded and establishes a new framework requiring a Canadian parent's substantial connection to Canada.

title: ‘Housefull 5’ box office collection: Akshay starrer collects Rs 23 cr on its first day
content: Akshay Kumar's 'Housefull 5' hit theaters on June 6, 2025, with two alternate endings. The film has garnered ₹23 crore on its opening day, surpassing 'Housefull 4' and 'Sky Force'. With an ensemble cast and a murder mystery plot set on a cruise ship, the movie has witnessed a 28.88% occupancy rate, peaking during night shows.

title: Vijay Mallya relates how he told Arun Jaitley he was flying to the UK before he left India
content: In a recent podcast interview, Vijay Mallya claimed he informed then Finance Minister Arun Jaitley about his departure to London in March 2016, prior to leaving India. Mallya stated he was unaware of any lookout circular against him at the time.

title: Former secretary among 3 acquitted in coal block case
content: A Delhi court acquitted former coal ministry officials H C Gupta, K S Kropha, and K C Samaria in a case concerning irregularities in the allocation of Jharkhand's Mahuagarhi coal block to JAS Infrastructure. However, the firm and its director, Manoj Kumar Jayaswal, were convicted, with sentencing arguments set for July 8.

title: Stephenson - Beasley face-off turns ugly with raunchy comments
content: Former NBA stars Lance Stephenson and Michael Beasley had a face-off. This took place before their $100K 1v1 match. The pre-game interaction turned nasty. Beasley made raunchy comments. The event was at The Next Chapter. Their 1v1 challenge happened on June 6. The winner got $100,000. Kyrie Irving was a special guest commentator. The event was streamed live.

title: Amit Shah launches language hub to 'decolonise' admin
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah launched the Bharatiya Bhasha Anubhag, an Indian languages section, to reduce English's role in official communication. This initiative aims to facilitate seamless communication between the Centre and non-Hindi speaking states by enabling translation of official documents.

title: 'Victims' can challenge acquittal under Sec 372 CrPC: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has affirmed that victims in cheque bouncing cases, as per Section 372 of CrPC, possess the right to challenge acquittal orders. This right, stemming from a 2009 amendment, is distinct from the complainant's appeal rights under Section 378.

title: Home loans: How will 1% RBI repo rate cut impact your EMI?
content: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has significantly reduced the repo rate by 50 basis points, bringing the total cut to 1% since February, a move set to lower home loan EMIs. Experts suggest this could push home loan rates closer to sub-8%, benefiting borrowers.

title: A month after Operation Sindoor's start, 2 trains send message to Pakistan
content: Prime Minister Modi addressed a public gathering in Katra, Jammu and Kashmir, condemning Pakistan for targeting the region's tourism industry and attacking humanity and Kashmiriyat in Pahalgam. He accused Pakistan of attempting to incite communal riots and destroy the livelihoods of poor Kashmiris. Modi lauded the resilience of the people and highlighted Operation Sindoor, a decisive blow to Pakistan-based terrorists.

title: 'American Justice': Man sent to El Salvador back to face federal charges
content: Kilmar Abrego Garcia, wrongly deported to El Salvador in March, will return to the US to face federal charges after diplomatic negotiations. His lawyer criticizes the government's handling of the case, emphasizing due process rights. Abrego Garcia faces charges of conspiracy and transporting illegal aliens, some allegedly linked to MS-13.

title: Musk's Starlink finally gets government licence to launch satcom services
content: Elon Musk's Starlink has received government approval to launch satellite-based communication services in India, including consumer and enterprise internet solutions. This follows the granting of three key licenses. While spectrum allocation is still pending, Starlink will need to establish ground infrastructure, a process requiring security clearances and several months to complete.

title: Apache lands safely after mid-air snag
content: An Indian Air Force Apache attack helicopter executed an emergency landing near Saharanpur, Uttar Pradesh, on Friday due to a technical snag warning. Following thorough inspections, the helicopter was safely flown back to Sarsawa air station, with no reported damage or injuries to the crew. This incident follows a previous hard landing involving another Apache helicopter in Ladakh last April.

title: Brics Parliamentary Forum condemns Pahalgam terror hit
content: The Brics Parliamentary Forum strongly condemned the Pahalgam terrorist attack, a move seen as a rebuke to Pakistan's justification of anti-India terror. The forum, including China, committed to combating terrorism in all forms, including cross-border movement and financing. Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla emphasized joint efforts to curb financial support to terrorist organizations and enhance intelligence sharing among nations.

title: Foreign policy has collapsed, outreach failed: Congress
content: The Congress party criticized the Modi government's foreign policy, asserting its failure as no country condemned Pakistan for terrorism during all-party delegation tours. They highlighted Russia's statement crediting Donald Trump for mediating the India-Pakistan ceasefire, indicating a shift in global perception. The party lamented Pakistan's resurgence on the world stage, evidenced by high-level receptions and UN appointments.

title: BJP slams Rahul Gandhi, calls him Pakistan's spokesperson
content: BJP leaders have strongly criticized Rahul Gandhi for allegedly echoing Pakistani propaganda. Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan accused Gandhi of being Pakistan's spokesperson, citing his remarks on India's alleged surrender to foreign pressure. This comes after a Pakistani minister used Gandhi's criticism of PM Modi to bolster anti-India narratives, prompting further condemnation from Indian officials like Kiren Rijiju.

title: Mirwaiz urges PM Modi to bridge ‘dil ki doori’ by releasing Kashmiri prisoners, Mufti echoes him
content: Following the inauguration of the Vande Bharat Express, Mirwaiz Umar Farooq urged PM Modi to bridge the 'dil ki doori' by releasing Kashmiri prisoners, emphasizing that human connections are more vital than infrastructure.

title: Excited schoolkids get a joyride on train's debut run
content: Katra railway station buzzed with excitement as students celebrated the launch of the Jammu-Kashmir rail link, including the Vande Bharat train. Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw announced plans to extend operations from Jammu station in September. PM Modi inaugurated the Chenab and Anji Khad Bridges, inspected the structures, and interacted with engineers, marking a significant milestone for connectivity.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Activist files police complaint against Virat Kohli
content: A complaint has been filed against cricketer Virat Kohli by a social activist following the stampede outside Bengaluru's Chinnaswamy Stadium. HM Venkatesh submitted the complaint at the Cubbon Park police station, prompting authorities to consider it within the existing case. Police confirmed that the complaint will be examined as part of the ongoing investigation into the stampede incident.

title: 2nd unofficial Test, Day 1: KL Rahul roars back with ton ahead of England Tests
content: India A reached 316/7 against England Lions on Day 1 of the second unofficial Test after a shaky start. Chris Woakes' early strikes left India A at 40/2, but KL Rahul's fluent 116 and Karun Nair's 40 steadied the innings. Dhruv Jurel (52) and Nitish Kumar Reddy contributed, though wickets fell regularly.

title: Foreign students in US: At 4.2 lakh, Indians fuelled surge in 2024; ICE releases report
content: In 2024, the US saw a 5.3% increase in international students, totaling 15.8 lakh, primarily driven by Indian students who surged by 11.8%. However, recent data reveals a sharp decline of 11.3% between March 2024 and March 2025, with a significant drop in Indian students, potentially due to visa issues and job market uncertainties.

title: Class act! KL Rahul smashes century vs England Lions in second Unofficial Test
content: KL Rahul showcased his batting prowess on Day 1 of the 2nd Unofficial Test against England Lions, scoring a century off 151 balls at the County Ground in Northampton. The experienced right-hander's innings included 13 boundaries and a six. With 58 Test appearances for India, Rahul is a key player in English conditions, having previously scored two centuries in England.

title: 50+ best Eid Mubarak wishes, messages, & quotes to share on Eid-ul-Adha 2025
content: Eid-ul-Adha 2025 is approaching, a time for families and communities to unite in celebration of sacrifice, compassion, and faith. Sending heartfelt wishes and messages strengthens bonds and spreads the spirit of the occasion. This collection of Eid Mubarak greetings offers ways to express love and blessings to family and friends, fostering joy and togetherness during this significant Islamic festival.

title: Exclusive | Olympian Deepika Kumari on criticism: 'I'd be the biggest fool if ... '
content: Deepika Kumari, India's celebrated archer, secured her 18th World Cup medal, fueled by her Olympic aspirations. Despite past heartbreaks, she remains determined, focusing on rebuilding her fundamentals with a new coach and support. Kumari acknowledges the challenges in Indian archery, including high expectations and equipment costs, while looking forward to the LA 2028 Olympics and the inclusion of compound archery.

title: 'Staged drama': TMC MLA's remark on Op Sindoor triggers row; BJP seeks probe
content: Trinamool Congress MLA Narendranath Chakraborty sparked controversy by allegedly calling Operation Sindoor a "staged drama," accusing PM Modi of manipulating patriotic sentiments. He later claimed his words were twisted, while the TMC distanced itself from the remark. The BJP has demanded an NIA probe into Chakraborty's alleged anti-India links following his controversial statement.

title: Trump vs Musk: Who has more to lose? Why stakes are high for both!
content: A feud between Donald Trump and Elon Musk has erupted, triggering political and financial turmoil. Musk's criticism of Trump's "One Big Beautiful Bill" threatens its passage, while Trump considers canceling government contracts with Musk's companies like SpaceX and Tesla.

title: 6 Killed, 80 Injured In Intense Russian Air Attacks In Kyiv, Says Ukraine
content: Russia launched an intense missile and drone barrage at the Ukrainian capital Kyiv in the early hours of Friday, killing at least six people, Ukrainian officials said, as powerful explosions reverberated across the country.

title: US Court Allows DOGE Access To Social Security Data Of Millions Of Americans
content: A divided US Supreme Court on Friday granted President Donald Trump's Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) access to the social security data of millions of Americans.

title: Trump Can Bar Associated Press From Key White House Events For Now: US Court
content: President Donald Trump can bar The Associated Press from some White House media events for now, a federal appeals court ruled Friday, pausing a lower court order to give access...

title: 3 Dead As Pest Control Plane Crashes In Mexico
content: A small airplane from Guatemala involved in fighting an outbreak of flesh-eating larvae crashed in southern Mexico on Friday, killing three people, authorities said.

title: Head Of Tesla's Optimus Humanoid Robot Program To Exit Firm: Report
content: The head of Tesla's Optimus program, Milan Kovac, is leaving the company, casting uncertainty over chief executive Elon Musk's humanoid robot project, Bloomberg News reported on Friday, citing a person familiar with the matter.

title: Man Mistakenly Deported Under Trump Administration Now Faces US Charges
content: Kilmar Abrego Garcia, the man mistakenly deported from Maryland to El Salvador by the Trump administration, has returned to US to face criminal charges of transporting illegal immigrants within the U.S., Attorney General Pam Bondi said.

title: 'Good Start': National Conference On Kashmir Rail Link Inaugurated By PM Modi
content: Political parties, cutting across affiliations and ideologies, Friday welcomed the Kashmir rail link inaugurated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, hoping for a boost in trade and tourism in the valley.

title: 10 BRICS Nations Condemn Pahalgam Attack, Back 'Zero Tolerance' On Terror
content: Representatives of the Parliaments of 10 member countries, including India, participated in the annual meeting of the 11th BRICS Parliamentary Forum held in Brasilia on June 4-5, 2025.

title: Gunfight Breaks Out Between Security Forces, Militants In Arunachal Pradesh
content: A gunfight broke out between security personnel and suspected militants along the India-Myanmar border in Arunachal Pradesh's Longding district, a defence official said on Friday.

title: "Stood Against Terrorists": PM Modi Praises Pahalgam Attack Victim
content: The family of Syed Adil Shah, a pony rider slain in the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack, expressed profound gratitude to Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday.

title: Turkmenistan Says 'Gateway To Hell' Fire, Raging For Over 50 Years, Tamed
content: An enormous fire has been raging in Turkmenistan for more than 50 years and nobody has been able to tame it - yet. Known as the 'Gateway to Hell', the Darvaza Gas Crater is a massive gas well that got ignited back in 1971.

title: "Mediation Between Two Unequals Not Possible": Shashi Tharoor On Trump's Claims
content: Shashi Tharoor has said that to suggest one can mediate between two unequals is not possible because there is no equivalence between terrorists and their victims, amid repeated claims by Trump that he "helped settle" the tensions between India, Pak.

title: "Unhappy With Duplicity": Sources On Why Siddaramaiah Sacked His Top Aide
content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah was apparently "unhappy with the duplicity shown" by his political secretary, MLC K Govindaraj, in the wake of Bengaluru stampede deaths that led to his sacking on Friday, top sources have told NDTV.

title: "I Stand Slightly Demoted...": Omar Abdullah To PM Modi On Statehood Restoration
content: Chief Minister Omar Abdullah on Friday used the flagging-off ceremony of the first train to Kashmir by PM Katra to subtly but clearly articulate his government's demand for the restoration of statehood to Jammu and Kashmir.

title: "What Drama... They Are On A Firing Spree": BJP MP After Bengaluru Tragedy
content: Calling the spree of suspensions in the wake of Bengaluru stampede deaths "drama", BJP MP Tejasvi Surya on Friday hinted that scapegoating has taken place and accused Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and his Deputy DK Shivakumar of evading responsibility.

title: "Children Deserve Compassion...": Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta On School Hiring Bouncers
content: Amid "alarming" reports of schools employing bouncers to intimidate parents and students, Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta on Friday asserted that children deserve compassion and not coercion.

title: Stampede vs Mild Lathicharge: KKR And RCB's Mega, But Different Celebrations
content: Wednesday's stampede - in which 11 were killed and 47 injured - after fans gathered to cheer the long-awaited crowning of Royal Challengers Bengaluru as IPL champions, has brought the first such grand celebrations by an IPL team into focus.

title: US Lawmaker Tells Pak Delegation To Eliminate "Vile" Terror Group Jaish-e-Mohammad
content: A senior American lawmaker has told a visiting Pakistani delegation, led by Bilawal Bhutto Zardari, that the country should do "all it can" to eliminate the "vile" terrorist group Jaish-e-Mohammed as well as ensure protection of religious minorities.

title: "Dark, Sleazy": Sean 'Diddy' Combs' Ex-Girlfriend Recounts "Hotel Nights"
content: An ex-girlfriend of Sean Combs testified of sex with a network of paid male escorts at the music mogul's behest and that he asked her to transport drugs for him.

title: How Horses, Mules Helped In Navigating Steep Slopes To Build Chenab Bridge
content: To make the vision of "Kashmir to Kanyakumari" come alive, the project team behind the construction of the Chenab bridge faced several challenges. Among them was how to reach the location surrounded by the steep slopes of the Himalayas.

title: ‘Ready to facilitate for a reasonable fee’: Russia mocks Trump-Musk feud
content: A public falling out between Donald Trump and Elon Musk has become a spectacle in Moscow, with Russian officials seizing the opportunity for mockery and strategic advantage. The feud, triggered by Musk's criticism of Trump's policies, escalated rapidly, leading to public insults and potential repercussions for Musk's government contracts.

title: 'Not good enough for Test debut': Easwaran flops again for India A; internet reacts
content: India A faced early setbacks in the second unofficial Test against England Lions as their top-order faltered, with skipper Abhimanyu Easwaran's poor form continuing. Chris Woakes's early breakthroughs put India A under pressure, but KL Rahul's century and Dhruv Jurel's contribution helped them recover. Easwaran's failure at No. 3 has raised concerns about his international readiness.

title: 'Virat Kohli could come out of Test retirement if ... '
content: Former Australia captain Michael Clarke speculates that Virat Kohli might reconsider his Test retirement if India faces a significant defeat in the upcoming England series. Clarke believes that strong fan and team management support could entice Kohli, who deeply values Test cricket, to return. He also noted Rohit Sharma's Test retirement, highlighting the tactical loss for the team.

title: Delhi airport flight cuts: Over 100 flights to be affected daily; runway upgrade from June 15
content: Get ready for potential flight changes at Delhi airport. From June 15 to September 15, about 114 daily flights will be cancelled. This is due to runway upgrades. Runway 10/28 will be closed for instrument landing system enhancements. The upgrade will improve safety during low visibility. Passengers should check their flight status in advance.

title: Sources: Man Utd increase offer for Mbeumo
content: Gab Marcotti reacts to Jadon Sancho's decision to return to Man United after his loan at Chelsea. (0:44) Manchester United  have upped their offer for  Brentford  forward  Bryan Mbeumo , sources have told ESPN. United have already seen the offer of an overall package of around £55 million ($74.5m) knocked back by Brentford. Sources have told ESPN that the improved offer is worth more than £60m. United are pushing to get the deal done as quickly as possible. They've already agreed to trigger the £62.5m release clause in  Matheus Cunha 's contract at Wolves. The Brazilian will formally complete his move to Old Trafford after the international break. Mbeumo, who scored 20  Premier League  goals last season, is next on Ruben Amorim's list as he looks to cure his team's goalscoring problems. According to sources, club bosses have been made aware that the 25-year-old favours a move to United despite interest from Newcastle.

title: Is Novak Djokovic a real contender for the French Open title?

title: Ranking the NFL’s most likely worst-to-first teams
content: 25 teams have gone from worst to first in their division in a single season . the Texans are a recent example . there are clear indicators that help guide us as to which teams are most likely to go from best to first .

title: Tyrese Haliburton has made the leap, and the Thunder should be terrified
content: the Pacers beat the Oklahoma City Thunder 111-110 in game 1 of the NBA Finals . he hit the shot with 0.3 seconds remaining in the game . the homage to Reggie Miller has taken place over the past few weeks .

title: To succeed at Western Kentucky, Tyson Helton seeks gunslingers
content: western Kentucky head coach Tyson Helton evaluates a quarterback . he says he wants a player completely unaffected by the moment . "there's not one damn great quarterback who don't walk up there like John Wayne," helton says .

title: UFC 316 expert picks, best bets: How can O'Malley take back Dvalishvili's title?
content: Sean O'Malley takes on titleholder merab Dvalishvili at uFC 316 on saturday (10 p.m. ET on ESPN PPV) this is O'malley's first fight since the loss . Julianna Pea puts her women's bantamweight title on the line .
